This sketch will consist of a single face (face\\_1). Face\\_1 will contain one loop (loop\\_1). Loop\\_1 will consist of 7 line segments. 1. line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] 2. line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.6] 3. line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.6], End Point [0.5625, 0.6] 4. line\\_4: Start Point [0.5625, 0.6], End Point [0.375, 0.6] 5. line\\_5: Start Point [0.375, 0.6], End Point [0.1875, 0.6] 6. line\\_6: Start Point [0.1875, 0.6], End Point [0.0, 0.6] 7. line\\_7: Start Point [0.0, 0.6], End Point [0.0, 0.0] After creating the 2D sketch, scale it using the sketch\\_scale parameter, which is 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. The extrusion depth towards the normal is 0.0012 and the extrusion depth opposite the normal is also 0.0012. This completes the construction of the first intermediate CAD part. The length, width, and height of this part are equal to 0.75, 0.0023, and 0.75 units, respectively. By following these instructions, the junior CAD designer should be able to create an accurate 3D model of the first intermediate CAD part.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Cylindrical Object with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Hollow Center Construct a CAD model of a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, connected by a cylindrical tube. The object is symmetrical and has a hollow center. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector to [0.0941, 0.1045, 0.1482]. Next, create a 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system. Draw eight loops on the sketch. Each loop consists of either two lines or an arc and two lines. The first loop (loop_1) consists of a line from [0.0912, 0.0912] to [0.2201, 0.0912], an arc from [0.2201, 0.0912] to [0.0912, 0.2201], and a line from [0.0912, 0.2201] to [0.0912, 0.0912]. The second loop (loop_1 in face_2) consists of an arc from [0.0912, 0.2231] to [0.2201, 0.3521], a line from [0.2201, 0.3521] to [0.0912, 0.3521], and a line from [0.0912, 0.3521] to [0.0912, 0.2231]. The third and fourth loops (loop_1 in face_3 and face_4) are similar to the first loop, but with different start and end points. The fifth and sixth loops (loop_1 in face_5 and face_6) are similar to each other, and consist of a line, a line, and an arc. The seventh and eighth loops (loop_1 in face_7 and face_8) are similar to the second loop, but with different start and end points. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.4788. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system. Extrude the 3D sketch such that the depth towards the normal is 0 and the depth opposite the normal is 0.1186. Set the operation to CutFeatureOperation. The height of this intermediate part is 0.1186, and the width and length are equal to the diameter of the circles, which is 0.4788. The final shape is a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, connected by a cylindrical tube. The object is symmetrical and has a hollow center. The height of the final shape is 0.1482, and the width and length are equal to the diameter of the circle at the base, which is 0.8478.</description>
